title: Calories in a Manhattan
meta_description: Discover calories in a manhattan cocktail, including carbs, alcohol content, full nutrition breakdown, and recipe tweaks for lower calories.
assumptions: Standard recipe: 2 oz rye whiskey, 1 oz sweet vermouth, 2 dashes bitters, 1 maraschino cherry; served over ice, no added sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, recipe variations, and garnishes. Alcohol content affects calorie absorption; consult labels or apps for precision.

quick_answer.text: A standard Manhattan has about 140 calories, mostly from alcohol and vermouth sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison with drink labels.

tweaks.label: Use dry vermouth instead of sweet

faqs.q: How many calories in a Manhattan cocktail?
faqs.a: Approximately 140 calories for a standard serving.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in a Manhattan?
faqs.a: Alcohol from whiskey (about 140 kcal per 2 oz) and sugars from sweet vermouth.

faqs.q: Does a Manhattan have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: About 10.5 g carbs (mostly sugars), 0 g protein, and 0 g fat.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in a Manhattan?
faqs.a: Use dry vermouth, skip the cherry, or opt for a smaller pour to cut 20-40 kcal.

faqs.q: Is Manhattan nutrition the same for bourbon vs. rye?
faqs.a: Similar calories; bourbon may add slight fat, but difference is negligible (~5 kcal).
